Post-processing for BT–SBM posterior draws

Source: R/inference_helper.R, R/utils.R
inference_helper.Rd

Relabels each MCMC draw by descending block rate \(\lambda\), computes the posterior similarity matrix (PSM), point partitions (Binder and minVI), summary stats on the number of clusters, and per-player assignment probabilities.

Relabels each MCMC draw by descending block rate \(\lambda\), computes the posterior similarity matrix (PSM), Binder and minVI point partitions, cluster count summaries, and per-player assignment probabilities.

Usage

inference_helper(x_samples, lambda_samples)

inference_helper(x_samples, lambda_samples)

Arguments

x_samples

integer matrix (M x K). Cluster labels per draw (each row = one draw).

lambda_samples

numeric matrix (M x K). Block rates per draw (aligned with labels).

Value

A list with components:

  • x_samples_relabel, lambda_samples_relabel — relabeled draws.

  • co_clustering — PSM (K x K).

  • partition_binder, minVI_partition, partition_expected.

  • n_clusters_each_iter, avg_n_clusters.

  • player_block_assignment_probs (K x K data.frame).

  • block_count_distribution (data.frame with num_blocks, count, prob).

  • top_block_count_per_iter, avg_top_block_count.

A list with components:

  • x_samples_relabel, lambda_samples_relabel — relabeled draws.

  • co_clustering — PSM (K x K).

  • partition_binder, minVI_partition, partition_expected.

  • n_clusters_each_iter, avg_n_clusters.

  • player_block_assignment_probs (K x K data.frame).

  • block_count_distribution (data.frame with num_blocks, count, prob).

  • top_block_count_per_iter, avg_top_block_count.

Details

Relabeling is done within each draw by sorting occupied blocks by decreasing \(\lambda\). Block 1 is the “top” block in that draw.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(1)
M <- 100; K <- 6
x  <- matrix(sample.int(3, M*K, TRUE), M, K)
lam <- matrix(rexp(M*K), M, K)
out <- inference_helper(x, lam)
str(out)
} # }
if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
set.seed(1)
M <- 100; K <- 6
x  <- matrix(sample.int(3, M*K, TRUE), M, K)
lam <- matrix(rexp(M*K), M, K)
out <- inference_helper(x, lam)
str(out)
} # }
